After the game, Haack explained that he struggled with the cold and windy conditions, but was happy with some of his better kicks — including a 52-yard punt when the Bills had been backed up inside their own 20.

His season ended in disastrous fashion on Saturday, with the 49ers special teams unit blocking a 39-yard field goal attempt at the end of the half with Bojorquez as the holder and then tying the game in the fourth quarter on a blocked punt returned for a touchdown.

The Green Bay Packers punter played a role in a pair of costly miscues in the team’s 13-10 loss to the San Francisco 49ers in the NFC divisional playoff game, with the Niners using their special teams play to fuel the win and advance to the NFC Championship game.

“One of the big knocks on Corey Bojorquez and likely the reason the Rams traded him was that Sean McVay was worried he’d have a punt blocked against the 49ers in the playoffs and returned for a game-tying touchdown,” noted SB Nation’s TurfShowTimes.

After a rough season finale, Haack had a light workload against in a 47-17 drubbing of the New England Patriots in the Wild Card round.

Punter Under Scrutiny
Bojorquez had been solid through three seasons with the Bills, but the team ultimately let him leave in free agency and he signed on with the Packers.
“I think I had three or four punts that, actually, I was happy with in that game, going into that gusty wind,” Haack told the Buffalo News.
The Bills punter shanked a 28-yard punt that was saved by offsetting penalties, but his re-kick ended up worse, netting just 21 yards.
His next was even worse, with Haack bobbling a difficult snap and evading pressure before pooching a kick that went just seven yards.
The Bills never called Haack’s number during the game, scoring touchdowns on all seven drives before a final kneel-down.
